p: The emergence of new infectious diseases is characterized by a sudden invasion or spread of diseases typically known to be rare or uncommon (Morens et al. 2008). Emerging viruses are newly recognized or newly evolved viruses or those that occurred previously in a population but show increased incidence or expansion into new geographical, host or vector range (WHO 2004). Re-emerging viruses, on the other hand, include those viruses that had previously decreased in incidence but are currently experiencing an upsurge (Morse 1995). These agents present significant challenges to researchers regarding their epidemiology, vaccine design and eradication (Ahmed et al. 2014).
